intro: Myostoma, commonly known as the "false nettle," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or greenish flowers that are often clustered in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Myostoma species are known for their aromatic foliage, which can be used in herbal remedies. The genus includes several species, with Myostoma palustre being one of the most commonly encountered in North America.
